        Consolidated Content:
Ludwig van Beethoven lived in Heiligenstadt from April to October 1802, during a difficult time when he was coming to terms with his growing deafness. This period marked the start of his "Middle Period" in music. Beethoven spent 35 years in or near Vienna, living in over 60 different locations. He also spent time in Gneixendorf and was a guest at the Dolná Krupá mansion. Beethoven's career as a composer is conventionally divided into early, middle, and late periods, with the "middle" period lasting from 1802 to 1812. Beethoven's influence on the music of the Romantic period is significant, and his work is typically divided into three periods: "Early," "Middle" or "Heroic," and "Late."

Analysis:
